body.p: Oxygen is a cross-platform application which runs only on Windows designed to accommodate all of your XML editing, authoring, developing, and publishing needs.
The first version of Oxygen was 1.0.0, released in 1998.

Oxygen XML Editor is a robust, feature-rich, and versatile tool designed to meet the needs of professionals working with XML, XSLT, XQuery, and related technologies. Widely regarded as one of the most powerful XML editing tools available, it provides an intuitive interface combined with advanced functionality to facilitate efficient and accurate editing, transformation, and validation of XML documents. Oxygen XML Editor supports a wide range of XML standards, including DITA, DocBook, TEI, and XHTML, making it an essential tool for technical writers, software developers, and content managers. It includes features such as syntax highlighting, real-time validation against schemas (e.g., DTD, XSD, RELAX NG), intelligent content completion, and a powerful debugging environment for XSLT and XQuery. Its robust support for collaborative workflows, version control systems like Git, and integration with CMSs ensures that teams can work seamlessly on complex projects. Additionally, its cross-platform compatibility and extensibility through plugins make it adaptable to a variety of use cases. Whether you are authoring structured content, managing metadata, or developing web services, Oxygen XML Editor provides a comprehensive toolkit that simplifies complex processes and boosts productivity.
